info.description: We are providing several API endpoints for external partners which are described in this documentation. All endpoints are using a REST-like interface, meaning they are called via HTTP with a specific payload (described separately for each endpoint, don't forget to set the Content-Type header accordingly) and respond with an application/json payload.
info.title: FIASCO Calculation Service API

post.description: Input data is processed asynchronously, results are delivered via webhook.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Please provide the name and version of your application here.

parameters.name: Token
parameters.description: An authorization token will be provided to you.

200.description: The request has been accepted and will be processed asynchronously. The response contains the ID of the created calculation request.

400.description: One of the input parameters does not match the requirements. Details are provided in the response body.

401.description: Your credentials could not be authenticated.

403.description: You are not authorized to create new calculation requests.

500.description: An internal error has occured. Additional details might be provided in the response.

post.description: This webhook is called when the calculation request has been processed. The webhook is called at least once.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Name and version of the application providing the calculation.

parameters.name: Token
parameters.description: An optional authorization token that you provided to us.

200.description: The webhook has been received successfully (all 2xx responses are considered to mean this).

400.description: A client-side error occured (all 4xx responses are handled like this).

401.description: A client-side error occured (all 4xx responses are handled like this).

403.description: A client-side error occured (all 4xx responses are handled like this).

500.description: A server-side error occured (all 5xx responses are handled like this). In this case we will try to redeliver the webhook notification a few times.

laborRatesCountry.description: Country code (ISO 3166-1 ALPHA-2) for the ZIP code.

laborRatesZipCode.description: The zip code for which average labor rates should be determined

paintSystem.description: The paint system to base the calculation on (AZT or Manufacturer)

replacementPartsSurcharge.description: Relative surcharge for replacement parts (e.g. 0.1 for 10%) [Audatex block code 22]

paintMaterialPercentage.description: Relative percentage of paint material in relation to labor costs (e.g. 0.3 for 30%) [Audatex block codes 40 and 51 depending on chosen paint system]

smallPartsPercentage.description: Relative percentage of small parts material in relation to labor costs (e.g. 0.01 for 1%) [Audatex block codes 40 and 51 depending on chosen paint system]

referenceId.description: A reference ID that is added to the request for future reference (e.g. case ID, order ID, etc.)

data.description: Base64-encoded image data. Formats: JPEG or PNG

content_type.description: The MIME type of the image (e.g. 'image/jpeg', 'image/png')

mileage.description: Indicates the number of kilometers the vehicle has driven.

firstRegistrationDate.description: Date of first registration of the vehicle in the format as defined by full-date in [RFC3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339#section-5.6) ('yyyy-mm-dd'). Additionally we support the format 'dd.mm.yyyy'

licensePlate.description: Will be added to the calculation result (for further reference). Not required for the actual calculation.

audaNetRecipient.description: If specified, the finished calculation will be sent via AudaNet to this recipient. Format according to Audatex B2B interface. The value contains a type prefix followed by a colon followed bt the ID of the receiver. The type prefix can be 'MemberId', 'LoginId', 'CustomerId', 'CommId', or 'ExternalOrganisationId'

sucess.description: Either true (request was successfully created) of false (an error occured). Always available.

message.description: Describes the return status (e.g. error details). Can be null or empty.

calculationRequestId.description: ID of the newly created request. Only available when 'success' is true.

calculationText.description: The calculation text as returned by the calculation engine. Only available when 'success' is true.

referenceId.description: The reference ID that was passed in the original request.

audaNetCaseId.description: The AudaNet case ID. Only available when 'success' is true and if an 'audaNetRecipient' was specified when the calculation was requested.

referenceId.description: A reference ID that we add to the request for future reference (e.g. case ID, order ID, etc.)
